com.threerings.gwt.ui
Class FX

java.lang.Object
  com.threerings.gwt.ui.FX

public class FX
extends java.lang.Object

Creates animation effects.

Constructor Summary
FX()
           
 
Method Summary
static Command delay(Command command, int delay)
          Returns a command that, when executed itself, will execute the supplied command after the specified millisecond delay.

          Creates an animation that will move the specified child of the specified absolute panel.

          Creates an animation that will move the specified popup panel.

Constructor Detail

FX

public FX()
Method Detail

reveal

public static WipeAnimation reveal(SimplePanel target)
Creates an animation that reveals the supplied target panel (wiping it from height zero to full height). The animation can be subsequently configured via its fluent methods. The returned animation is configured fluently, for example: FX.reveal(target).fromTop().onComplete(action).run(250);

unreveal

public static WipeAnimation unreveal(SimplePanel target)
Creates an animation that unreveals the supplied target panel (wiping it down to height zero). The animation can be subsequently configured via its fluent methods. The returned animation is configured fluently, for example: FX.unreveal(target).fromBottom().onComplete(action).run(250);

move

public static MoveAnimation move(PopupPanel target)
Creates an animation that will move the specified popup panel. If the popup is not showing or not visible, it will be shown and made visible immediately after moving it to the start position. The returned animation is configured fluently, for example: FX.move(target).from(x, y).to(dx, dy).onComplete(action).run(500);

move

public static MoveAnimation move(AbsolutePanel parent,
                                 Widget target)
Creates an animation that will move the specified child of the specified absolute panel. The returned animation is configured fluently, for example: FX.move(panel, target).from(x, y).to(dx, dy).onComplete(action).run(500);

delay

public static Command delay(Command command,
                            int delay)
Returns a command that, when executed itself, will execute the supplied command after the specified millisecond delay. For convenience purposes, if a null command is supplied, null is returned.
